data.title: Mesh doesn't reload until .tscn is closed and reopened
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits

Repro steps:

1) Create a cube in Blender and export it as .obj
2) In Godot, set import settings to "multiple objects" so that it generates a .mesh (I initially wanted to import it as a mesh for use in gridmap, intention related to #9910)
3) Assign that .mesh to a MeshInstance, notice you can see the mesh now
4) Modify the mesh in Blender and reexport it
5) Notice Godot probably reimports the mesh because the loading bars show briefly, however the mesh is still unchanged in the scene
6) Now close the scene, and reopen it: the mesh is now up to date

data.title: Cannot create a MeshLibrary for GridMap, either using ArrayMesh or procedural meshes
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1

I was trying to get a MeshLibrary setup quickly to prototype something, but noticed CubeMesh for example doesn't work when used in a scene that I convert to a MeshLibrary. 
Then I tried regular ArrayMesh from Blender, it still generated an empty MeshLibrary. I don't see errors at conversion time.

Here is the scene I used for the mesh library:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/28999852-5865bb48-7a58-11e7-8312-c1af447b11bf.png)


Note: I also can't figure out how to make one without the "Convert to MeshLibrary". The platformer demo is the only gridmap I know of that works, but its MeshLibrary is a binary .res (so I can't remake one from it) and trying to convert `tiles.scn` also ends up in an empty MeshLibrary.

data.title: ClassDB: Adds get_property_index method
data.body: Needed by bindings generators.

data.title: Renames properties and methods to avoid ambiguities
data.body:
- Method `Node2D.scale(Vector2)` renamed to `Node2D.apply_scale(Vector2)`
- Property `BaseButton.is_pressed` renamed to `BaseButton.pressed`

data.title: Small suggestions for the TextEdit node
data.body:
Basically, functions like "set_text()" and" "set_readonly()" should be available in the inspector, like the LineEdit node.

Also like LineEdit, when set to read-only, it could change colors to visually show it:

![screenshot at 2017-08-05 17-18-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30739239/28998488-daddbf68-7a02-11e7-9fa8-a3227309e81b.png)

data.title: NodePath option to find target in editor node tree
data.body:
Adds new option "Find" to the exported NodePath. It will be visible only if target node is on the currently loaded scene. After clicking it, given node will be selected in editor node tree.
![path_find_target](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/28997053-7d984f4e-7a0c-11e7-99e5-cfa7df8a24ee.gif)

data.title: apply_impulse Function on a RigidBody node applies random angular velocity on it.
data.body:
**OS:** Windows 8.1-64bits
**Version:** 2.1.3


**Issue description:**
Applying impulse to a RigidBody or Rigidbody2D node when it's mode i set to Rigid not only applies impulse but also applies a random angular velocity on it, which makes it goes crazy in different directions.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a RigidBody or RigidBody2D node, add a script to it, and call the apply_impulse() function in any other function( _ready(), _fixed_process()... ).


**Link to minimal example project:**
[Impulse Issue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1202437/Impulse.Issue.zip)

data.title: Segment based polygon shapes only get collisions on edges
data.body:
**Godot version: 3 26ff90eae**


**Issue description:**
If a polygon shape is built in segment mode, the interior of the shape is empty, only the segments are valid collisions.



**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a PolygonShape2D in segment mode.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[shapetest-bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1202374/shapetest-bug.zip)
(the one in the center is in segment mode)

data.title: Initialize Particles2D draw order property
Add format loader for ImageTexture to load supported images directly.
data.body: Sometimes we really need to load images without import them(such as a gui tool to open and show images in the disk) so I made this.

data.title: Kinematicbody2d move function with wrong values on the dictionary
data.body:
Windows 10 - Godot version:3.0

**Issue description:**
In kinematicbody2d the return of the method _move has some wrong values. In the code the mapping of the normal is wrong and the dictionarty will return the normal with the same value has the position.
On the line 951 of physics_body_2d.cpp there's the following code:

d["normal"] = col.collision;

but that's wrong because we need someting like this:

d["normal"] = col.**normal**;

I hope that I explained that well

data.title: iOS copy touch coordinate as is
data.body:
This deceptively simple fix seems to solve #10080 

The change itself makes sense as the coordinate system in Godot 2.1 was indeed reversed.
What mystified me was when testing this in the morning, iOS seemed to be reacting on the orientation of the phone, an issue I had encountered with processing the orientation sensors.

Anyway I've tested this in portrait, landscape left and landscape right orientations using the material tester demo and I get consistent results. Note that portrait upsidedown crashes for me but thats an unrelated issue.

data.title: Implement OS.has_touchscreen_ui_hint() in HTML5 platform
data.body:
Allows checking for touch screen availability on the HTML5 platform.

If this implementation turns out unreliable, we'll probably have to resort to waiting for touch events and return `false` until then

data.title: Improve HTML5 canvas management
data.body:
- `OS.set_window_maximized` hides page content
 - Fix sporadic full-screen render-size bug in Chromium
 - Smoother resizing for maximized canvas

data.title: Combining "Autowrap" with "Clip Text" only clips the text
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot version: 3.0.alpha1**


**Issue description:**
When using a LineEdit, if both "Autowrap" and "Clip Text" options are selected, only the text clipping will happen.

data.title: Android orientation setting ignored when running apk (always landscape)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux (Fedora 26, 64bit) to build apk
Nexus 5 - Android 7.1.1 to run apk

Godot 3-alpha1
Godot 3 (compiled from master)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Project is running on Android in landscape mode even though it was set to run in portrait mode. Orientation does not change if smartphone is rotated. Orientation is not affected by screen-orientation-lock of the smartphone.

Orientation should respect options set in export settings.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Project Settings / Display / Window / Handheld / Orientation set to 'portrait' (also tested with 'Sensor')
2. Export Android: Options / Screen / Orientation set to 'Portrait'
3. Export apk
4. Install apk
5. See the wrong orientation being used

Edit:
It is working for 2.1.3 if the orientation is set to 'portrait' inside the project settings AND the android export settings. But the godot 3 versions are still only landscape.

data.title: AnimationPlayer track keys can not be loaded again after first loading with ResourceLoader
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, Godot Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64

**Issue description:**
AnimationPlayer track keys can not be loaded again after first loading with ResourceLoader.
 
Situation: We are in an **in-game** Level Editor, not in Godot Editor!

After modifying a previously loaded scene and loading it again, modified AnimationPlayer track keys are not loaded instead they keep their modified value even if the whole scene (including the AnimationPlayer) is queued_free and completely reloaded from disk.

Expected:
Animation track keys (which are part of the loaded Scene) are are the ones in the loaded Scene not the ones in memory of the queued_free scene.

Details:
I chose GDScript modified scenes (.tscn) as a save format, so I can also use the Godot Editor to tweak the Levels. 

Loading:
`playable_map = load(path).instance()`

I also tried to disabling caching:
`playable_map = ResourceLoader.load(path,"",true).instance()`

**Steps to reproduce:**
Following the steps in the attached project to reproduce the bug
- Load saved map
- change track keys
- Load map again

-> changes to track keys are not loaded, but other changes to other nodes are.


**Link to minimal example project:**
[RessourceLoaderAnimPlayerBug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1201690/RessourceLoaderAnimPlayerBug.zip)

data.title: Fix warp_mouse_pos on macOS [2.1]
data.body: Fixes #10081 same as #10099 for 2.1 branch

data.title: Fix warp_mouse_pos on macOS
data.body: Fixes #10081

data.title: Setting color on a hidden CanvasModulate node modulates all open scenes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, both Godot 2.1.3 and 3.x have this problem

**Steps to reproduce:**
Have multiple 2D scenes open(not mandatory), create a CanvasModulate node, tick visibility off, change the color.

**Expected result:**
Hidden CanvasModulate has no effect

**Actual result:**
All open scenes are modulated with the chosen color, unless they have their own, non-hidden CanvasModulate node.

EDIT: Should have clarified, this only has effect inside of editor.

data.title: fixed loading old theme styleboxes
data.body: often `get_stylebox("some_name", "some_type")` was used in constructors. since the node wasn't part of the editor node tree at this point in time it wasn't loading the editor theme. Instead it loaded the `default_theme`. the is the reason that some UI Elements were purple. see screenshot:

data.title: fixed Import LineEdit to label + label stylebox
data.body:
- added a `normal` stylebox to label. default is StyleBoxEmpty
 - changed drawing for label, so that it draws correct with styleboxes with margins
 - changed the `LineEdit` in the import to use a `Label` with the style box of a lineEdit node.

data.title: 2D Occluders with cull mode enabled show light before the shadow
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot 3 alpha**


**Issue description:**
Enabling the cull mode on LightOccluder2D shows some light where the shadow should start

![lightoccluderbug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/28982197-55860cee-792b-11e7-94d8-98670d0f647b.png)
_The right one is counter clockwise and light penetrates a bit the occluder_

**Steps to reproduce:**
Enable a culling mode on a LightOccluder2D.
Can be tested with "light and shadows" demo, using culling mode in clockwise.

data.title: AudioStreamRandomPitch but fixed pitch?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3 Feature Request

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I notice that AudioStreamRandomPitch doesn't only change pitch like AudioEffectPitchShift. It also changes tempo, which might be a desirable audio effect in game. However, users have no control over this pitch/tempo value as it's random at playback time. AFAIK there's no AudioEffect that modifies tempo.

Basically, I want AudioStreamRandomPitch with user-defined pitch/tempo.

data.title: Freeze on exit when adding New AudioStreamOGGVorbis to AudioStreamPlayer
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Antergos x86_64 - Godot 3 7ac50b5

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
This error occurs when adding new AudioStreamOGGVorbis to AudioStreamPlayer node:
```
instance at 0x7f43f90, data (nil)
ERROR: instance_playback: Condition ' data == __null ' is true. returned: ovs
   At: modules/stb_vorbis/audio_stream_ogg_vorbis.cpp:125.
ERROR: set_stream: Condition ' stream_playback.is_null() ' is true.
   At: scene/audio/audio_player.cpp:133.
```
Adding AudioStreamOGGVorbis to AudioStreamRandomPitch works however.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. New AudioStreamPlayer(2D)
2. Stream: New AudioStreamOGGVorbis
3. Error occurs, Stream remains "(null)"
4. Freeze on editor exit

data.title: [Suggestion] Make it possible for Light2D light to penetrate into obstacles until hitting a backface.
data.body:
Example of the desired effect from a toy of my own:

![](http://i.imgur.com/rKiJ3EJ.png)

Includes penetration distance limit(in pixels) for large occluders, and a (broken) option to skip short gaps.

data.title: 2D lighting shaders are severely limited by their inability to affect the final color.
data.body:
*Bugsquad edit:* Version 2.1.3-stable

By which I mean: There is no way to affect the actual final color, and setting either `SHADOW.a` or `LIGHT.a` produces no result if the area isn't already lit/shadowed.

The reason why this is a problem is simple: With CanvasModulate, it is possible for unshadowed areas to be dark, and set the equivalent of ambient light, but there is no way to mask some areas to always be fully lit, or have different ambient from within a shader.

This might be something of a corner case(though IMO, not really), but I'm sure that it is possible to find other issues with the system as well.

data.title: Clicking mesh property inside MeshInstance will result in editor graphic artifacts
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 17.04, 7ac50b523b8cb313245e2fbdd16b5561c88b3aeb, GTX 1060

**Issue description:**
After opening dae model in editor, navigating to `MeshInstance` node and clicking on 'Mesh` property in inspector, graphic artifact will appear in 3d view part of the editor.
![brokenmaterialpreview](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/28978757-836a47da-7947-11e7-85eb-3894dba3cfe8.gif)



**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download sample project
2. Open res://Issues/BrokenMaterialPreview/diamond1.dae
3. Click MeshInstance node in scene tree
4. Find `Mesh` property and click on it

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Issues3:Broken Material Preview.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1201075/Issues3.Broken.Material.Preview.zip)
